newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares seen flat or down, wait for Handlowy.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares seen flat or down, wait for Handlowy.

text.p: Polish shares were expected to stay flat or slightly down on Friday after Thursday's 0.3-percent dip followed by stronger selling after price fixing and a 1.8-percent fall of the WIG 20 index in continuous trade.

Analysts said the public-offering pricing of Bank Handlowy, due on Friday, would help investors appraise listed banks and decide how the offer, which starts next week and is seen worth a total of $1 billion, would draw capital from the bourse. @

Analysts were split on whether the currency crisis in the Czech Republic would affect Polish stocks, noting that while some foreign investors differentiated little between the two countries, others might shift some share buying to Poland.
